review: A little difficult to setup.  While following the simple instructions precisely, my phone would disconnect from my WI-FI network, each time I would enter setup mode, while giving a message that Chromecast couldn't connect to the internet.  As soon as I would switch to my Wi-Fi settings, it would immediately re-connect to my network, but switching back to setup would disconnect it again.  Finally, I was able to get Chromecast attempt a connection to my Wi-Fi network in my phone's Wi-Fi settings, and after getting it connected, everything worked fine.  Not sure why I was having this problem, but I suspect it was either to vague instructions or maybe Chromecast was attempting to connect to the wrong network.After I got it setup, everything worked great.  It came with a HDMI extension cable, in case your HDMI port is snuggled away in the back of your TV, like mine, but oddly, the cable is only a few inches long and the instructions warn against using any other cable.  That still may be long for a better connection, but it seems like a longer cable would have been more beneficial.My only disappointment with how it works is that there is no slacker app.  I subscribe to Slacker and don't care for itune, Pandora or Iheartradio.  I'm sure that won't be the last disappointment, but I'm otherwise very happy with it.  I've had my PC connected to my TV for 20 years, but recently purchased my first store-bought machine and it doesn't have a video-out, so that was what prompted me to purchase Chromecast.  I also like that it's so small and portable, although I'm still scratching my head over the short HDMI extension cable.
